intro: Schismatoglottis ciliata, commonly known as the hairy schismatoglottis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its dark green, strap-shaped leaves with fine, hairy margins. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Schismatoglottis ciliata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
